channel.title: Posts on Welcome to my blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Welcome to my blog

item.title: Catalog of my old blogger
item.description: Introducing my new blog written solely in R Markdown When I realized it is so convenient to write blog directly using R Markdown, I searched if there is a specialized tool for it. And I found Blogdown, an R package written by Yihui Xie, who is also the author of R Markdown. Catalog As a summary, I would like to create a catalog for the main topics I wrote on google blogger before July 2018.

item.title: Spatial data in R: Dividing raster layers into equal-area rings
item.description: Saturation in 10 cities with equal-area rings R Code for one city Results for the ring saturations Average saturation in each ring Methodology This data visualization example include: * Import .img file as a raster * Turn raster into a dataframe of points (coordinates) and values * Dividing the points into 100 equal-area rings * Calculate Built-up Area/Urban Extent for each ring * Turn dataframe into raster

item.title: How to Draw Heatmap with Colorful Dendrogram
item.description: Data Version 1: Color both the branches and labels Version 2: color only the labels. Version 3: If there is no color, and we do not reorder the branches This data visualization example include: * Hierarchical clustering, dendrogram and heat map based on normalized odds ratios * The dendrogram was built separately to give color to dendrogramâ€™s branches/labels based on cluster using dendextend * Heatmap is made by heatmap.

item.title: eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost): Better than random forest or gradient boosting
item.description: Overview About the Data 1. Extreme Gradient Boosting 2. Gradient boosting 3. Random Forest 4. Lasso 5. Best Subset Compare MSEs Code Overview I recently had the great pleasure to meet with Professor Allan Just and he introduced me to eXtreme Gradient Boosting (XGBoost). I have extended the earlier work on my old blog by comparing the results across XGBoost, Gradient Boosting (GBM), Random Forest, Lasso, and Best Subset.
